IRS990.Desc: PUBLICATIONS: THE GUILD PUBLISHES OPERA NEWS, A MONTHLY PRINT ANDDIGITAL MAGAZINE ABOUT OPERA HISTORY, PERFORMANCES, AND ARTISTS, THATHELPS FOSTER A DEEPER APPRECIATION OF OPERA AND TO MAINTAIN IT AS ATHRIVING, CONTEMPORARY ART FORM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS: THE GUILD FOSTERS COLLABORATION, LITERACY SKILLS, SELF-CONFIDENCE AND AN INCREASED CAPACITY FOR SELF-EXPRESSION IN CHILDREN WITH CUSTOMIZED EDUCATION PROGRAMS INTEGRATED INTO THE CURRICULUM OF THEIR SCHOOLS. THE GUILD ALSO OFFERS WORKSHOPS ANDCOMMUNITY PROGRAMS FOR OLDER STUDENTS AND ADULTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SUPPORT OF THE METROPOLITAN OPERA (THE "MET"): THE GUILD SUPPORTS THE MET'S LAFFONT COMPETITION BY FUNDING AN ANNUAL AWARD. THE GUILD ALSO SERVES AS A FUNDRAISING AGENT FOR THE MET BY ENCOURAGING INDIVIDUALS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE MET AT VARIOUS GIVING LEVELS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LINCOLN CENTER FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GUILD HAS MAINTAINED A COLLECTION OF VARIOUS OPERA-RELATED MEMORABILIA OVER THE YEARS. AS OF JUNE 30, 2022, THE MAJORITY OF THE COLLECTION HAS BEEN SOLD. ALL REMAINING COLLECTION ITEMS ARE CATALOGUED AND PRESERVED, AND ACTIVITIES VERIFYING THEIR EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING THEIR CONDITION ARE PERFORMED REGULARLY. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE COLLECTION POLICIES OF MUSEUMS, THE COST OR VALUE OF THESE COLLECTIONS IS NOT INCLUDED ON THE BALANCE SHEETS. THE COLLECTIONS ARE COMPRISED OF VARIOUS ITEMS USED WITHIN AND BY FAMOUS OPERAS AND ARE USED TO: (I) DEVELOP, SUPPORT, AND CULTIVATE A WIDER PUBLIC INTEREST IN THE METROPOLITAN OPERA AND THE ART FORM AT-LARGE, (II) TO FURTHER MUSICAL EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION, AND (III) TO SPONSOR AND GIVE ASSISTANCE TO OPERATIC, MUSICAL AND CULTURAL PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS OTHER ACTIVITIES OF AN EDUCATIONAL CHARACTER.
THE GUILD'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF THREE DONOR RESTRICTED FUNDS ESTABLISHED TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS, EDUCATION PROGRAMS, AND EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS.

THE GUILD IS SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD'S (THE "FASB") ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION ("ASC") TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES, AS IT RELATES TO ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. SINCE THE GUILD HAS ALWAYS RECORDED THE POTENTIAL TAX LIABILITY FOR UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAXES, AND DUE TO ITS GENERAL TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, MANAGEMENT BELIEVES ASC TOPIC 740 HAS NOT HAD, AND IS NOT ANTICIPATED TO HAVE, A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE GUILD'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF REMAINDER INTEREST IN TRUST -448,265.
GRANTS MADE TO THE MET ARE FOR UNRESTRICTED OPERATING SUPPORT. THE GUILD REVIEWS THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND 990 OF THE MET AND MONITORS THE FINANCIAL NEEDS OF THE MET.
THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS ARE BASED ON THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED.

THE METROPOLITAN OPERA GUILD, INC. (THE "GUILD"), INCORPORATED IN NEW YORK IN 1936, IS ORGANIZED (I) TO DEVELOP, SUPPORT, AND CULTIVATE A WIDER PUBLIC INTEREST IN THE METROPOLITAN OPERA AND THE ART FORM AT-LARGE, (II) TO FURTHER MUSICAL EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION, AND (III) TO SPONSOR AND GIVE ASSISTANCE TO OPERATIC, MUSICAL AND CULTURAL PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS OTHER ACTIVITIES OF AN EDUCATIONAL CHARACTER.
LINE 6 - GROSS RECEIPTS - IS THE SUM OF FORM 990, PART VIII, COLUMN A, LINES 6B (COLUMNS I AND II), LINE 7B (BOTH COLUMNS I AND II), LINE 8B, LINE 9B, LINE 10B, AND LINE 12.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE FORM 990 AND RECOMMENDS THE APPROVAL OF THE FORM 990 TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED ELECTRONICALLY TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GUILD HAS A FORMAL WRITTEN CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST POLICY. ANNUALLY, BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEETS TO REVIEW AND APPROVE SENIOR MANAGEMENT'S COMPENSATION ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GUILD WILL PROVIDE ITS BY-LAWS, ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UPON REQUEST. FORM 990, PART IX, STATEMENT OF FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES, LINE 1 THE MET IS AN INDEPENDENT NOT-FOR-PROFIT MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION THAT MAINTAINS THE GUILD'S MEMBERSHIP RECORDS AND PROVIDES MEMBERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AT NO CHARGE TO THE GUILD. IN FISCAL-YEAR 2022, THE GUILD PASSED THROUGH UNRESTRICTED MEMBERSHIP CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE MET OF $6,241,249 AND MADE AN ADDITIONAL DISCRETIONARY CONTRIBUTION OF $20,000 TO SUPPORT A NATIONAL COUNCIL AWARD.

PENSION BENEFIT GUARANTY CORPORATION SETTLEMENT EXPENSE -540,000. GAIN ON EXTINGUISHMENT OF DEFINED BENEFIT PLAN 3,719,589. PENSION-RELATED BENEFITS - RELATED CHANGED OTHER THAN SERVICE COSTS 661,083. CHANGE IN VALUE OF REMAINDER INTEREST IN TRUST -448,265.
